Package elements

Class Camera

java.lang.Object
elements.Camera
public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
class to represent the camera. We treat the camera as having a single point of view

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Camera.CameraBuilder
    Builder Pattern, by this class we are updating the parent class (Camera), instance that we are interested in creating even before we create it

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private double distance
    distance from camera to view plane
    private double height
    view - plane's height
    private Point3D p0
    the camera location in 3D
    private Vector vRight
    Direction vector that defines what is the "right" direction of the camera
    private Vector vTo
    vector toward - the direction vector in which the camera is aimed
    private Vector vUp
    Direction vector that defines what is the "top" of the camera
    private double width
    view - plane's width

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Modifier Constructor Description
    private Camera​(Camera.CameraBuilder cameraBuilder)
    Private CTOR of the class built by Builder Pattern only

    In the first iteration we want to check the colors in all the corners of the pixel and in the center and of course keep them in order to avoid re-checking later

    constructing 4 rays from one ray, using if we got a different color in the previous test of the colors in the 'square' of the pixel

    private Point3D getPointOnViewPlane​(Ray ray)

    • Camera

      private Camera​(Camera.CameraBuilder cameraBuilder)
      Private CTOR of the class built by Builder Pattern only
      Parameters:
      cameraBuilder - A virtual entity of the class we are currently implementing

  • Method Details

    • constructRayThroughPixel

      public Ray constructRayThroughPixel​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      method that calculate the exact location of the ray in the view plane
      Parameters:
      nX - number of columns in the view plane
      nY - number of rows in the view plane
      j - The column in the matrix where the desired position is
      i - The row in the matrix where the desired position is
      Returns:
      the ray from the camera to view plane

    • constructBeam

      public java.util.LinkedList<Ray> constructBeam​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, double divide)
      consruct a beam of rays around one ray, inside the pixel, according to the division it received, and inside each sub-square takes out a random point for checking the color
      Parameters:
      nX - amount of pixels in width
      nY - amount of pixels in height
      j - the pixel's column
      i - the pixel's row
      divide - size of single pixels view plane
      Returns:
      list of internal rays

    • constructFiveRays

      public Ray[] constructFiveRays​(Ray[] myRays, double nX, double nY)
      In the first iteration we want to check the colors in all the corners of the pixel and in the center and of course keep them in order to avoid re-checking later
      Parameters:
      myRays - array of the rays, at first it contains only the central ray in the third index
      nX - number of pixels in row
      nY - number of pixels in column
      Returns:
      array of the rays

    • constructPixelCenterRay

      public Ray constructPixelCenterRay​(Ray ray, double nX, double nY)
      gets the middle of pixel
      Parameters:
      ray - ray to move to the middle of it
      nX - number of pixels in the view plane in the x axis
      nY - number of pixels in the view plane in the y axis
      Returns:
      ray in the middle of the pixel

    • constructFourRays

      public java.util.List<Ray> constructFourRays​(Ray ray, double nX, double nY)
      constructing 4 rays from one ray, using if we got a different color in the previous test of the colors in the 'square' of the pixel
      Parameters:
      ray - the ray to separate
      nX - number of pixels in x axis
      nY - number of pixels in y axis
      Returns:
      list of 4 rays for adaptive super sampling

    • getPointOnViewPlane

      private Point3D getPointOnViewPlane​(Ray ray)
      Function to find a specific point on the plane we need to calculate the distance from the point on the camera to the plane for that we use the cos of the angle of the direction ray with vTo vector
      Parameters:
      ray - ray to the specific point
      Returns:
      the distance to the point

    • randomPointRay

      private Ray randomPointRay​(Point3D pixStart, double col, double row)
      using in simple anti alysing for calculate color in a point in a sub-square
      Parameters:
      pixStart - up left corner of the sub-square
      col - the column
      row - the row
      Returns:
      random ray inside the range

    • getP0

      public Point3D getP0()
      P0 getter
      Returns:
      P0

      VTo getter

      VUp getter
      Returns:

    • getVRight

      public Vector getVRight()
      VRight getter (using cross product)
      Returns:
      vRight
